page.title: 08St Wilfred's Church
page.content: The church is 800 years old .A 12th century church.It is called Saint Wilfried's the local Saint a 7th century Saint. We have a list of rectors going back to the 12th century. There is a famous font dating from the 15th century. The two most famous rectors are John Bramhall 1618-1633, he became Arch bishop of Armagh in Ireland, and William Kingsley 1858-1916 and he kept being rector till he died at a 101 years old. The last rector in South Kilvington left in 1946. Now the parish is run from Thirsk. Earlier the church was linked with Upsall castle, who held the patronage.
